title: Unlocking Cures for Pediatric Cancer With Artificial Intelligence
summary: The document is an executive order titled 'Unlocking Cures for Pediatric Cancer With Artificial Intelligence' issued on September 30, 2025. It outlines the U.S. Administration's commitment to leveraging AI to combat pediatric cancer, which is the leading cause of disease-related death for children aged 0-19. The order highlights the Childhood Cancer Data Initiative (CCDI), a $50 million annual investment in childhood cancer research. It emphasizes the potential of AI to transform pediatric cancer care by improving diagnostics, treatments, and clinical trials. The order directs the MAHA Commission to develop AI-driven solutions, enhance data infrastructure, and encourage private sector investment. It also stresses the importance of data sharing and interoperability while ensuring patient privacy.
